entity.name: Norse - Thor
entity.subtitle: God of Thunder, Protector ofMidgard
entity.description: The mightiest warrior of the Aesir, wielder of the hammer Mjolnir, and defender of gods and humans against the chaotic forces of the giants. Red-bearded and fierce in battle yet a friend to mankind, Thor was the most widely worshipped of the Norse gods, especially among farmers and common folk who relied on his storms for rain and his protection against evil.

relationships.allies: Tyr(fellow warrior god), occasionallyLoki(their relationship is complex), humanity in general
relationships.enemies: The giants (jotnar) in general, especiallyJormungandrtheMidgardSerpent (his destined killer atRagnarok), giant sorcerers, and the forces of chaos

family.children: Modi ("Courage") and Magni ("Strength") with J√°rnsaxa, Thrud ("Power") with Sif, Ullr (stepson, Sif's son from previous relationship)
family.siblings: Baldr(half-brother), Hod (half-brother), Vidar (half-brother), Vali (half-brother) - many sons ofOdinby different mothers

archetype.name: ‚ö° THUNDER GOD
archetype.description: Thor embodies the Thunder God archetype - the mighty protector who wields storm powers to defend the cosmic order against chaos.
